name: Lorenz-63 system
equations: dx/dt = σ (y - x); dy/dt = x (ρ - z) - y; dz/dt = x y - β z
description_simple: A three-dimensional deterministic system of nonlinear differential equations that models convection and is known to show chaotic behavior for certain parameter values.
description_complex: A deterministic three-dimensional dynamical system governed by coupled nonlinear differential equations with strong sensitivity to initial conditions, producing a butterfly-shaped strange attractor at the classical parameter setting (σ = 10, ρ = 28, β = 8/3). It is one of the canonical examples of deterministic chaos.
